"There have been dishonesty, fraud, the turning away of a man from his rights, and disregarding the principles of the commandments of God. You have had men, schemes, and devising of plans, with the idea that you could as a Board have power to do anything that would serve the Conference, and bring in a revenue. But it was more grievous in the sight of God because you there were covering the dishonest practises, saying, 'The temple of the Lord! The temple of the Lord are we!' Yes; but that temple was just as much in need of cleansing as the temple courts in the days when Christ was upon the earth. The Lord hates the mixture he 
                                                                           17
saw in the earthly temple. Unholy bartering in the temple courts brought forth the righteous indignation of an insulted God."
